intro: Hieracium rhodoglossum, commonly known as the red-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. Its striking red-veined leaves and yellow flowers make it a distinctive species within the genus Hieracium. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, sun-exposed environments.
